intro: Pythagorea alata, commonly known as the winged bean, is a leguminous plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive winged leaves and elongated pods that contain edible seeds. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, and it produces a high yield of seeds per plant. The botanical features of Pythagorea alata make it an important crop in many parts of Southeast Asia and Africa.
